required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Evicel to Reduce Blood Loss in Total Knee Replacement Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Evicel to Reduce Blood Loss in Total Knee Replacement Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

clinical_study.source: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

brief_summary.textblock: Application of "Evicel" hemostatic matrix during operation for unilateral total knee replacement surgery (TKA) will result in decreased bleeding and postoperative drain output, a reduction in transfusion requirements, and less reduction of hemoglobin.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hemoglobin on Day 0 Compared to Preoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and on the day of surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hematocrit on Day 0 Compared to Preoperatively
Change in Hemoglobin On Day 1 Compared to Preoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and one day after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hematocrit on Day 1 Compared to Preoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and one day after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hemoglobin on Day 2 Compared to Preoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and two days after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hematocrit on Day 2 Compared to Preoperatively
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and two days after surgery

primary_outcome.description: A measurement of the amount of blood drained from the knee.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Autologous Transfusion Units Over the Course of the Hospital Stay
primary_outcome.description: Units of autologous transfusion for each patient over the course of the hospital stay (an average of 3 days) were recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Units of Homologous Transfusion Over the Course of the Hospital Stay
primary_outcome.description: Units of homologous transfusion for each patient over the course of the hospital stay (an average of 3 days) were recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in International Normalized Ratio (INR) Level on Day 2 Compared to Preoperatively
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively and two days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The INR, a measure of the clotting tendency of blood, is a ratio of a patient's prothrombin time (the time a blood plasma takes to clot after the addition of tissue factor) to a normal prothrombin time.
A measurement of the degrees of motion of the operated knee three days after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Pain Scale on Day 3
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analog pain scale is a patient-reported measure of pain on a 10-point scale with 0 being no pain and 10 being worst possible pain. Drawings of faces indicate the level of pain associated with different points on the scale.
A measurement of the degrees of motion of the operated knee six weeks after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Pain Scale (at Rest) at 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analog pain scale is a patient-reported measure of pain on a 10-point scale with 0 being no pain and 10 being worst possible pain. Drawings of faces indicate the level of pain associated with different points on the scale. For the measure of pain at rest, the patient indicates their level of pain while seated or lying down, not moving.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Pain Scale (During Activity) at 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analog pain scale is a patient-reported measure of pain on a 10-point scale with 0 being no pain and 10 being worst possible pain. Drawings of faces indicate the level of pain associated with different points on the scale. For the measure of pain during, the patient indicates their level of pain while doing activities of daily living such as walking and moving from sitting to standing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Pain Scale (During Therapy) at 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analog pain scale is a patient-reported measure of pain on a 10-point scale with 0 being no pain and 10 being worst possible pain. Drawings of faces indicate the level of pain associated with different points on the scale. For the measure of pain during, the patient indicates their level of pain during physical therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Pain Scale (At Night) At 6 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The visual analog pain scale is a patient-reported measure of pain on a 10-point scale with 0 being no pain and 10 being worst possible pain. Drawings of faces indicate the level of pain associated with different points on the scale. For the measure of pain at night, the patient indicates their level of pain during or before sleep.

arm_group.description: Evicel is a fibrin sealant used for hemostasis when control of bleeding by ligature or other conventional procedures is ineffective or impractical. It has been shown to stop bleeding in 2 minutes or less. Evicel is a combination of a biologic activated component containing human fibrinogen and topical thrombin that functions on wet, actively bleeding tissue. It is a bioresorbable and biocompatible agent.
Patients will receive standard treatment for bleeding as practiced at the Hospital for Special Surgery.

intervention.description: Used for hemostasis to control bleeding. It has been shown to stop bleeding in 2 minutes or less. It is a combination of a biologic activated component containing human fibrinogen and topical thrombin functioning on wet, actively bleeding tissue.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of degenerative joint disease of the knee in patients medically suitable to undergo unilateral total knee arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergies to human blood products.
- History of bleeding disorders.
- Patients with previous arthrotomy, however, with exception of medial or lateral menisectomy.
- Patients taking Lovenox, Plavix, Aggrenox or erythropoetin. (coumadin is acceptable)
- Additionally, any patient with an intra-operative complication (i.e bone fracture, vascular injury) or post-operative complication that would affect bleeding tendency will be excluded although data will be recorded for later analysis. Also, any patient who has a complication with the suction drain (eg inadvertently being pulled out, suction failing) will have the remaining data points recorded and drain measurements will be excluded from analysis.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital for Special Surgery, New York

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty at the Hospital for Special Surgery from September 2010 to June 2012 were enrolled in a consecutive prospective manner on a voluntary basis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
